text:
I was somehow under the (obviously wrong) assumption that UEFI required
EVERYTHING used in secure boot to be signed - including images. What a
charlie-foxtrot.

metadata.topic: Just about every Windows and Linux device vulnerable to new LogoFAIL firmware attack
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Just about every Windows and Linux device vulnerable to new LogoFAIL firmware attack
metadata.email_text_original:
I was somehow under the (obviously wrong) assumption that UEFI required
EVERYTHING used in secure boot to be signed - including images. What a
charlie-foxtrot. -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of James Iversen Sent: Wednesday,
December 6, 2023 4:29 PM To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: Re:
[patchmanagement] Just about every Windows and Linux device vulnerable to new
LogoFAIL firmware attack Who else is looking for the exits? Sent from my iPhone
Link: None
